title: Generics
subject: Java
theory:
Generics allow types (classes and interfaces) to be parameters when defining classes, interfaces and methods.
Main goal: **Compile-time Type Safety**.

Code that uses Generics has many benefits over non-generic code:
1.  Stronger type checks.
2.  Elimination of casts.

common_mistakes.correction: `List<int>` is invalid. Must use Wrapper Class `List<Integer>`.

interview_questions.question: What is Type Erasure?
interview_questions.answer: Java removes generic type info during compilation. `List<String>` becomes `List` at runtime mostly for backward compatibility.

practice_problems.problem: Write a generic method to swap positions in array.
practice_problems.hint: <T> void swap(T[] a, int i, int j)

real_world_use_cases.description: ApiResponse<T> { T data; String error; } used in almost all Rest Controllers.

summary: Generics make code flexible and safe.
